column4: hi, i have the following problem: when doing certain things on my ubuntu server (like apt-get update && apt-get dist-upgrade or ./configure in the Asterisk-sourcedir) the box freezes completely up (nothing works then, not even NUMLOCK) or randomly reboots. memtest comes up fine
Have you had a look to see if there is anything in the logs - although with total locks sometimes there isn't
That sounds like temperature to me
Check your fans - if it is sometimes failing in boot it's probably not a well machine
Have you tried running it off the live CD for a while and see if it is stable like that?
going to do that next
As I say, it's also worth checking the logs - /var/log/messages etc from around the time of the hang - does it do it outside of X?
sometimes it freezes before the kernel even gets loaded, i am scanning the logs just in case,
If it's before the kernel is loaded then it really has to be a hardware problem of some type; it could be a dying disk I guess but you normally see some errors rather than a total hang
what could it be? ram is memtested. CPU ist doing fine. I did a find / | xargs md5sum and it worked fine (/proc etc. were excluded from the find)
additionally, both 5 V and 12 V seem to be stable (measured using a multimeter, so no sensors etc.)
Not sure really; I'd try taking all non-essential peripherals out and see if it stabilises; PSU is a possibility - but it's really difficult to find anything when machines just stop
I think I'd try running off a live CD to see if it's also unstable and if it is still unstable (which I'd assume it is) then I'd see if I could try swapping the PSU
./configure is a direct way to a freezeup - every time
That's pretty odd, I mean ./configure is a bit CPU and disc heavy - but CPU wise shouldn't compare with your md5sum
Is there any way to test a psu?
I believe there are some testers; but it's about the easiest thing to swap if you think RAM is OK
if i had a replacement handy, it would be easy...
Nod
find / | cat while md5'ing /dev/urandom works without crash!
./configure now worked a single time, did it again while watching tail -f /var/log/messages - freezeup without logs...
Ah, a heisenbug :-)
